question: Question_03
statement:
The population P(t) (in hundreds) of a colony of rabbits in year t is
given in the table:

t 0 2 4 6

P 5 7 8 9

Find the equation P(t) = a + bt of the least squares line that best
ï¬ts the data and use it to estimate the population at time t = 7.
sols:
First, we need to find the values of a and b by using the least squares
line or the line-of-best fit procedure. i.e. we need to solve for
$\vec{x}$ in$V^T *V*\vec{x}$=$V^T*\vec{P}$, where
$\vec{x}=\begin{bmatrix}
b\\ 
a
\end{bmatrix} , \vec{P}=\begin{bmatrix}
P _1\\ 
P _2\\ 
P _3\\ 
P _4
\end{bmatrix}=\begin{bmatrix}
5\\ 
7\\ 
8\\ 
9
\end{bmatrix}$

We see that it is the 1st degree polynomial, so our matrix for V is:

$V=\begin{bmatrix}
t _1 &1 \\ 
t _2 &1 \\ 
t _3 &1 \\ 
t _4 &1 
\end{bmatrix}=\begin{bmatrix}
0 &1 \\
2 &1 \\
4 &1 \\
6 &1
\end{bmatrix}, V^T=\begin{bmatrix}
0 &2 &4 &6 \\ 
1&1 &1 &1 
\end{bmatrix}$

Now we determine the vector
x\[\vec{x}\]=$(V^T*V)^{-1}*V^T*\vec{P}$=$(\begin{bmatrix}
0 &2 &4 &6 \\ 
1 &1 &1 &1 
\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}
0 &1 \\ 
2 &1 \\ 
4&1 \\ 
6&1 
\end{bmatrix})^{-1}(\begin{bmatrix}
0 &2 &4 &6 \\ 
1 &1 &1 &1 
\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}
5\\ 
7\\ 
8\\ 
9
\end{bmatrix})=\begin{bmatrix}
0.05 &-0.15 \\ 
-0.15 &0.7 
\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}
100\\ 
29
\end{bmatrix}$ =$\begin{bmatrix}
5.3\\ 
0.65
\end{bmatrix}$

Hence, a=0.65 and b=5.3. So we have P(t)=0.65+5.3t.

Finally, we use it to estimate the population at t=7: P(7)=37.75.
